Name: Abacus
Description: A standard tool used to make calculations.

Name: Acid (vial)
Description: As an action, you can splash the contents of this vial onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the acid as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 acid damage.

Name: Alchemist's Fire (flask)
Description: This sticky, adhesive fluid ignites when exposed to air. As an action, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

Name: Alchemist's Supplies
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Alexandrite
Description: A transparent dark green gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

Name: Alms Box
Description: A small box for alms, typically found in a priest's pack.

Name: Amber
Description: A transparent watery gold to rich gold gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Amethyst
Description: A transparent deep purple gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Amulet
Description: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section. To use the symbol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a shield.

Name: Antitoxin
Description: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid gains advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to undead or constructs.

Name: Aquamarine
Description: A transparent pale blue-green gemstone worth 500 gold pieces.

Name: Arcane Focus
Description: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Assassin's Blood (Ingested)
Description: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 6 (1d12) poison damage and is poisoned for 24 hours. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't poisoned. Ingested. A creature must swallow an entire dose of ingested poison to suffer its effects. The dose can be delivered in food or a liquid. You may decide that a partial dose has a reduced effect, such as allowing advantage on the saving throw or dealing only half damage on a failed save.

Name: Azurite
Description: An opaque mottled deep blue gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Backpack
Description: A backpack is a leather pack carried on the back, typically with straps to secure it. A backpack can hold 1 cubic foot/ 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

Name: Bagpipes
Description: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use bagpipes as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Ball Bearings (bag of 1,000)
Description: As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level, square area that is 10 feet on a side. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save.

Name: Banded Agate
Description: A translucent striped brown, blue, white, or red gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Barding
Description: Barding is armor designed to protect an animal�s head, neck, chest, and body. Any type of armor can be purchased as barding. The cost is four times the equivalent armor made for humanoids, and it weighs twice as much.

Name: Barrel
Description: A barrel can hold 40 gallons of liquid, or 4 cubic feet of solid material.

Name: Basket
Description: A basket can hold 2 cubic feet/40 pounds of gear.

Name: Bedroll
Description: You never know where you�re going to sleep, and a bedroll helps you get better sleep in a hayloft or on the cold ground. A bedroll consists of bedding and a blanket thin enough to be rolled up and tied. In an emergency, it can double as a stretcher.

Name: Bell
Description: A standard bell that rings, typically used for signaling.

Name: Bit and Bridle
Description: Standard equipment used to direct a mount.

Name: Black Opal
Description: A translucent dark green with black mottling and golden flecks gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces

Name: Black Pearl
Description: An opaque pure black gemstone worth 500 gold pieces.

Name: Black Sapphire
Description: A translucent lustrous black gemstone with glowing highlights worth 5,000 gold pieces.

Name: Blanket
Description: A thick, quilted, blanket made to keep you warm in cold weather.

Name: Block and Tackle
Description: A set of pulleys with a cable threaded through them and a hook to attach to objects, a block and tackle allows you to hoist up to four times the weight you can normally lift.

Name: Block of Incense
Description: A block of incense, typically found in a priest's pack.

Name: Bloodstone
Description: An opaque dark gray gemstone with red flecks worth 50 gold pieces

Name: Blue quartz
Description: A transparent pale blue gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Blue Sapphire
Description: A transparent blue-white to medium blue gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces.

Name: Blue spinel
Description: A transparent deep blue gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

Name: Bomb
Description: As an action, a character can light this bomb and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 3d6 fire damage.

Name: Book
Description: A book might contain poetry, historical accounts, information pertaining to a particular field of lore, diagrams and notes on gnomish contraptions, or just about anything else that can be represented using text or pictures. A book of spells is a spellbook.

Name: Boots
Description: A pair of boots - included as part of most sets of clothing.

Name: Bottle, Glass
Description: A bottle can hold 1 1/2 pints of liquid.

Name: Breastplate
Description: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

Name: Brewer's Supplies
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Bucket
Description: A bucket can hold 3 gallons of liquid, or 1/2 cubic foot of solid material.

Name: Burglar's Pack
Description: Includes a backpack, a bag of 1,000 ball bearings, 10 feet of string, a bell, 5 candles, a crowbar, a hammer, 10 pitons, a hooded lantern, 2 flasks of oil, 5 days rations, a tinderbox, and a waterskin. The pack also has 50 feet of hempen rope strapped to the side of it.

Name: Calligrapher's Supplies
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Caltrops (bag of 20)
Description: As an action, you can spread a bag of caltrops to cover a square area that is 5 feet on a side. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving this turn and take 1 piercing damage. Taking this damage reduces the creature's walking speed by 10 feet until the creature regains at least 1 hit point. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save.

Name: Camel
Description: Speed 50 ft., Carrying Capacity 480 lbs.

Name: Candle
Description: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

Name: Carnelian
Description: An opaque orange to red-brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

Name: Carpenter's Tools
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Carriage
Description: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

Name: Cart
Description: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

Name: Cartographer's Tools
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Case, Crossbow Bolt
Description: This wooden case can hold up to twenty crossbow bolts.

Name: Case, Map or Scroll
Description: This cylindrical leather case can hold up to ten rolled-up sheets of paper or five rolled-up sheets of parchment.

Name: Censer
Description: A censer, typically found in a priest's pack.

Name: Chain (10 feet)
Description: A chain has 10 hit points. It can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength check.

Name: Chain Mail
Description: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

Name: Chain Shirt
Description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Name: Chalcedony
Description: An opaque white gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Chalk (1 piece)
Description: A piece of chalk used for writing and marking on various surfaces.

Name: Chariot
Description: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

Name: Chest
Description: A chest can hold 12 cubic feet/ 300 pounds of gear.

Name: Chrysoberyl
Description: A transparent yellow-green to pale green gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

Name: Chrysoprase
Description: A translucent green gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

Name: Citrine
Description: A transparent pale yellow-brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

Name: Climber's Kit
Description: A climber's kit includes special pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness. You can use the climber's kit as an action to anchor yourself; when you do, you can't fall more than 25 feet from the point where you anchored yourself, and you can't climb more than 25 feet away from that point without undoing the anchor.

Name: Clothes, Common
Description: This set of clothes could consist of a loose shirt and baggy breeches, or a loose shirt and skirt or overdress. Cloth wrappings are used for shoes.

Name: Clothes, Costume
Description: This set of clothes is fashioned after a particular costume, typically meant for entertaining.

Name: Clothes, Fine
Description: This set of clothes is designed specifically to be expensive and to show it, including fancy, tailored clothes in whatever fashion happens to be the current style in the courts of the nobles. Precious metals and gems could be worked into the clothing.

Name: Clothes, Traveler's
Description: This set of clothes could consist of boots, a wool skirt or breeches, a sturdy belt, a shirt (perhaps with a vest or jacket), and an ample cloak with a hood.

Name: Cobbler's Tools
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Component Pouch
Description: A component pouch is a small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost (as indicated in a spell's description).

Name: Cook's Utensils
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Coral
Description: An opaque crimson gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

Name: Crowbar
Description: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

Name: Crystal
Description: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Diamond
Description: A transparent blue-white, canary, pink, brown, or blue gemstone worth 5,000 gold pieces.

Name: Dice Set
Description: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

Name: Diplomat's Pack
Description: Includes a chest, 2 cases for maps and scrolls, a set of fine clothes, a bottle of ink, an ink pen, a lamp, 2 flasks of oil, 5 sheets of paper, a vial of perfume, sealing wax, and soap.

Name: Disguise Kit
Description: This pouch of cosmetics, hair dye, and small props lets you create disguises that change your physical appearance. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to create a visual disguise.

Name: Donkey (or Mule)
Description: Speed 40 ft., Carrying Capacity 420 lbs.

Name: Draft Horse
Description: Speed 40 ft., Carrying Capacity 540 lbs.

Name: Dragonchess Set
Description: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

Name: Druidic Focus
Description: A druid can use a Sprig of Mistletoe (or holly) as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Drum
Description: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Dulcimer
Description: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Dungeoneer's Pack
Description: Includes a backpack, a crowbar, a hammer, 10 pitons, 10 torches, a tinderbox, 10 days of rations, and a waterskin. The pack also has 50 feet of hempen rope strapped to the side of it.

Name: Dynamite (Stick)
Description: As an action, a creature can light a stick of dynamite and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A character can bind sticks of dynamite together so they explode at the same time. Each additional stick increases the damage by 1d6 (to a maximum of 10d6) and the burst radius by 5 feet (to a maximum of 20 feet). Dynamite can be rigged with a longer fuse to explode after a set amount of time, usually 1 to 6 rounds. Roll initiative for the dynamite. After the set number of rounds goes by, the dynamite explodes on that initiative.

Name: Elephant
Description: Speed 40 ft., Carrying Capacity 1,320 lbs.

Name: Emblem
Description: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section. To use the symbol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a shield.

Name: Emerald
Description: A transparent deep bright green gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces

Name: Entertainer's Pack
Notes: Container, Deception, Exploration, Outerwear, Social, Utility
Description: Includes a backpack, a bedroll, 2 costumes, 5 candles, 5 days of rations, a waterskin, and a disguise kit.

Name: Explorer's Pack
Description: Includes a backpack, a bedroll, a mess kit, a tinderbox, 10 torches, 10 days of rations, and a waterskin. The pack also has 50 feet of hempen rope strapped to the side of it.

Name: Eye agate
Description: A translucent gemstone with circles of gray, white, brown, blue, or green worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Feed (per day)
Description: Standard feed typically consumed by a mount per day.

Name: Fire Opal
Description: A translucent fiery red Gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces.

Name: Fishing Tackle
Description: This kit includes a wooden rod, silken line, corkwood bobbers, steel hooks, lead sinkers, velvet lures, and narrow netting.

Name: Flask or Tankard
Description: A flask or tankard can hold 1 pint of liquid.

Name: Flute
Description: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Forgery Kit
Description: This small box contains a variety of papers and parchments, pens and inks, seals and sealing wax, gold and silver leaf, and other supplies necessary to create convincing forgeries of physical documents. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to create a physical forgery of a document.

Name: Galley
Description: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

Name: Garnet
Description: A transparent red, brown-green, or violet gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

Name: Glassblower's Tools
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Grappling Hook
Description: When tied to the end of a rope, a grappling hook can secure the rope to a battlement, window ledge, tree limb, or other protrusion.

Name: Gunpowder, Keg
Description: Gunpowder is chiefly used to propel a bullet out of the barrel of a pistol or rifle, or it is formed into a bomb. Gunpowder is sold in small wooden kegs and in water-resistant powder horns. Setting fire to a container full of gunpowder can cause it to explode, dealing fire damage to creatures within 10 feet of it (3d6 for a powder horn, 7d6 for a keg). A successful DC 12 Dexterity saving throw halves the damage. Setting fire to an ounce of gunpowder causes it to flare for 1 round, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

Name: Gunpowder, Powder Horn
Description: Gunpowder is chiefly used to propel a bullet out of the barrel of a pistol or rifle, or it is formed into a bomb. Gunpowder is sold in small wooden kegs and in water-resistant powder horns. Setting fire to a container full of gunpowder can cause it to explode, dealing fire damage to creatures within 10 feet of it (3d6 for a powder horn, 7d6 for a keg). A successful DC 12 Dexterity saving throw halves the damage. Setting fire to an ounce of gunpowder causes it to flare for 1 round, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

Name: Half Plate
Description: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps.

Name: Hammer
Description: This one-handed hammer with an iron head is useful for pounding pitons into a wall.

Name: Hammer, Sledge
Description: This two-handed, iron-headed hammer is good for smashing open treasure chests.

Name: Healer's Kit
Description: This kit is a leather pouch containing bandages, salves, and splints. The kit has ten uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabilize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check.

Name: Helm
Description: A helm - included as part of most sets of armor.

Name: Hematite
Description: An opaque gray-black gemstone worth 10 gold pieces.

Name: Herbalism Kit
Description: This kit contains a variety of instruments such as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and vials used by herbalists to create remedies and potions. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to identify or apply herbs. Also, proficiency with this kit is required to create antitoxin and any potion of healing.

Name: Hide
Description: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

Name: Holy Symbol
Description: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section. To use the symbol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a shield.

Name: Holy Water (flask)
Description: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a target creature, treating the holy water as an improvised weapon. If the target is a fiend or undead, it takes 2d6 radiant damage. A cleric or paladin may create holy water by performing a special ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour to perform, uses 25 gp worth of powdered silver, and requires the caster to expend a 1st-level spell slot.

Name: Horn
Description: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Hourglass
Description: A standard hourglass used to measure the passage of time.

Name: Hunting Trap
Description: When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage and stop moving. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet long). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 piercing damage to the trapped creature.

Name: Ink (1 ounce bottle)
Description: Ink is typically used with an ink pen to write.

Name: Ink Pen
Description: An ink pen is a wooden stick with a special tip on the end. The tip draws ink in when dipped in a vial and leaves an ink trail when drawn across a surface.

Name: Jacinth
Description: A transparent fiery orange gem worth 5,000 gold pieces

Name: Jade
Description: A translucent light green, deep green, or white gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

Name: Jasper
Description: An opaque blue, black, or brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

Name: Jet
Description: An opaque deep black gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Jeweler's Tools
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Jug or Pitcher
Description: A jug or pitcher can hold 1 gallon of liquid.

Name: Ladder (10 foot)
Description: This item is a straight, simple wooden ladder.

Name: Lamp
Description: A lamp casts bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

Name: Lantern, Bullseye
Description: A bullseye lantern casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

Name: Lantern, Hooded
Description: A hooded lantern casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil. As an action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

Name: Lapis Lazuli
Description: An opaque light and dark blue gemstone with yellow flecks worth 10 gold pieces.

Name: Leather
Description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Name: Leatherworker's Tools
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Little Bag of Sand
Description: A small bag of sand, typically found in a scholar's pack.

Name: Lock
Description: A key is provided with the lock. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick this lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Your DM may decide that better locks are available for higher prices.

Name: Longship
Description: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

Name: Lute
Description: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Lyre
Description: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Magnifying Glass
Description: This lens allows a closer look at small objects. It is also useful as a substitute for flint and steel when starting fires. Lighting a fire with a magnifying glass requires light as bright as sunlight to focus, tinder to ignite, and about 5 minutes for the fire to ignite. A magnifying glass grants advantage on any ability check made to appraise or inspect an item that is small or highly detailed.

Name: Malachite
Description: An opaque striated light and dark green gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Manacles
Description: These metal restraints can bind a Small or Medium creature. Escaping the manacles requires a successful DC 20 Dexterity check. Breaking them requires a successful DC 20 Strength check. Each set of manacles comes with one key. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick the manacles' lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Manacles have 15 hit points.

Name: Mason's Tools
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Mastiff
Description: Speed 40 ft., Carrying Capacity 195 lbs.

Name: Mirror, Steel
Description: A steel mirror is handy when you want to look around corners, signal friends with reflected sunlight, keep an eye on a medusa, make sure that you look good enough to present yourself to the queen, or examine wounds that you�ve received on hard-to-see parts of your body.

Name: Monster Hunter's Pack
Description: Includes a chest, a crowbar, a hammer, three wooden stakes, a holy symbol, a flask of holy water, a set of manacles, a steel mirror, a flask of oil, a tinderbox, and 3 torches.

Name: Moonstone
Description: A translucent white gemstone with a pale blue glow worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Moss agate
Description: A translucent gemstone with pink or yellow-white with mossy gray or green markings worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Navigator's Tools
Description: This set of instruments is used for navigation at sea. Proficiency with navigator's tools lets you chart a ship's course and follow navigation charts. In addition, these tools allow you to add your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make to avoid getting lost at sea.

Name: Obsidian
Description: An opaque black gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Oil (flask)
Description: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an additional 5 fire damage from the burning oil. You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level. If lit, the oil burns for 2 rounds and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Name: Onyx
Description: An opaque gemstone with bands of black and white, or pure black or white worth 50 gold pieces

Name: Opal
Description: A translucent pale blue with green and golden mottling gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces

Name: Orb
Description: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Padded
Description: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.

Name: Painter's Supplies
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Pan Flute
Description: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Paper (one sheet)
Description: A sheet of standard paper is made from cloth fibers.

Name: Parchment (one sheet)
Description: A sheet of parchment is a piece of goat hide or sheepskin that has been prepared for writing on.

Name: Pearl
Description: An opaque lustrous white, yellow, or pink gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Perfume (vial)
Description: A fragrant commodity typically used by the wealthy.

Name: Peridot
Description: A transparent rich olive green gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

Name: Pick, Miner's
Description: A miner's pick is designed to concentrate the force of its blow on a small area.

Name: Piton
Description: When a wall doesn�t offer handholds and footholds, you can make your own. A piton is a steel spike with an eye through which you can loop a rope.

Name: Plate
Description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Name: Playing Card Set
Description: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

Name: Poison, Basic (vial)
Description: You can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

Name: Poisoner's Kit
Description: A poisoner's kit includes the vials, chemicals, and other equipment necessary for the creation of poisons. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to craft or use poisons.

Name: Pole (10-foot)
Description: When you suspect a trap, you can put the end of your 10-foot pole through that hole in the wall instead of reaching in with your hand.

Name: Pony
Description: Speed 40 ft., Carrying Capacity 225 lbs.

Name: Pot, Iron
Description: An iron pot can hold 1 gallon of liquid.

Name: Potion of Healing
Description: A character who drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains 2d4 + 2 hit points. Drinking or administering a potion takes an action.

Name: Potter's Tools
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Pouch
Description: A cloth or leather pouch can hold 1/5 cubic foot/ 6 pounds of gear - or up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch.

Name: Priest's Pack
Description: Includes a backpack, a blanket, 10 candles, a tinderbox, an alms box, 2 blocks of incense, a censer, vestments, 2 days of rations, and a waterskin.

Name: Quartz
Description: A transparent white, smoky gray, or yellow gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

Name: Quiver
Description: A quiver can hold up to 20 arrows.

Name: Ram, Portable
Description: You can use a portable ram to break down doors. When doing so, you gain a +4 bonus on the Strength check. One other character can help you use the ram, giving you advantage on this check.

Name: Rations (1 day)
Description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

Name: Reliquary
Description: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section. To use the symbol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a shield.

Name: Rhodochrosite
Description: An opaque light pink gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Riding Horse
Description: Speed 60 ft., Carrying Capacity 480 lbs.

Name: Ring Mail
Description: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor.

Name: Robes
Description: A standard set of robes.

Name: Rod
Description: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Rope, Hempen (50 feet)
Description: Rope, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Name: Rope, Silk (50 feet)
Description: Rope, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Name: Ruby
Description: A transparent clear red to deep crimson gemstone worth 5,000 gold pieces

Name: Sack
Description: A sack can hold 1 cubic foot/ 30 pounds of gear.

Name: Saddle, Exotic
Description: An exotic saddle is required for riding any aquatic or flying mount.

Name: Saddle, Military
Description: A military saddle braces the rider, helping you keep your seat on an active mount in battle. It gives you advantage on any check you make to remain mounted.

Name: Saddle, Pack
Description: A standard saddle for a pack mount.

Name: Saddle, Riding
Description: A standard saddle for a riding mount.

Name: Saddlebags
Description: Standard saddlebags that can be attached to a mount's saddle.

Name: Sailing Ship
Description: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

Name: Sardonyx
Description: An opaque gemstone with bands of red and white worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Scale Mail
Description: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.

Name: Scale, Merchant's
Description: A scale includes a small balance, pans, and a suitable assortment of weights up to 2 pounds. With it, you can measure the exact weight of small objects, such as raw precious metals or trade goods, to help determine their worth.

Name: Scholar's Pack
Description: Includes a backpack, a book of lore, a bottle of ink, an ink pen, 10 sheets of parchment, a little bag of sand, and a small knife.

Name: Sealing Wax
Description: When you press a signet ring into warm sealing wax, you leave an identifying mark.

Name: Shawm
Description: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Shield
Description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Name: Shovel
Description: A standard shovel used for digging.

Name: Signal Whistle
Description: A small whistle used for signaling.

Name: Signet Ring
Description: Each signet ring has a distinctive design carved into it. When you press this ring into warm sealing wax, you leave an identifying mark.

Name: Sled
Description: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

Name: Small Knife
Description: A small knife, typically found in a scholar's pack.

Name: Smith's Tools
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Soap
Description: A commodity used for bathing.

Name: Spellbook
Description: Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

Name: Spiked Armor
Description: Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.

Name: Spikes, Iron (10)
Description: Standard iron spikes typically used with a hammer.

Name: Spinel
Description: A transparent gemstone of red, red-brown, or deep green worth 100 gold pieces

Name: Splint
Description: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints.

Name: Sprig of Mistletoe
Description: A druid can use a Sprig of Mistletoe (or holly) as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Spyglass
Description: Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

Name: Staff
Description: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Stake (Wooden)
Description: Stakes made out of wood, typically found in a monster hunter's pack.

Name: Star Rose Quartz
Description: A translucent rosy Gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Star Ruby
Description: A translucent ruby gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 1,000 gold pieces.

Name: Star Sapphire
Description: A translucent blue sapphire gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 1,000 gold pieces.

Name: String
Description: A 10-foot length of string, typically found in a burglar's pack.

Name: Studded Leather
Description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Name: Tent, Two-Person
Description: A simple and portable canvas shelter, a tent sleeps two.

Name: Thieves' Tools
Description: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

Name: Three-Dragon Ante Set
Description: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

Name: Tiger Eye
Description: A translucent brown gemstone with a golden center worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Tinderbox
Description: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch -- or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel -- takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

Name: Tinker's Tools
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Topaz
Description: A transparent golden yellow gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

Name: Torch
Description: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

Name: Totem
Description: A druid can use a Totem as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Tourmaline
Description: A transparent pale green, blue, brown, or red gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

Name: Turquoise
Description: An opaque light blue-green gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Vestments
Description: Religious clothing, typically found in a priest's pack.

Name: Vial
Description: A vial can hold 4 ounces of liquid.

Name: Viol
Description: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Wagon
Description: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

Name: Wand
Description: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Warhorse
Description: Speed 60 ft., Carry Capacity 540 lbs.

Name: Warship
Description: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

Name: Waterskin
Description: A waterskin can hold 4 pints of liquid.

Name: Weaver's Tools
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Whetstone
Description: A standard whetstone used to sharpen blades.

Name: Woodcarver's Tools
Description: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Wooden Staff
Description: A druid can use a Wooden Staff as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Wyvern Poison (Injury)
Description: This poison must be harvested from a dead or incapacitated wyvern. A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Injury. Injury poison can be applied to weapons, ammunition, trap components, and other objects that deal piercing or slashing damage and remains potent until delivered through a wound or washed off. A creature that takes piercing or slashing damage from an object coated with the poison is exposed to its effects.

Name: Yellow sapphire
Description: A transparent fiery yellow or yellow-green gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces

Name: Yew Wand
Description: A druid can use a Yew Wand as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Zircon
Description: A transparent pale blue-green gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.
